selected_quotes: 1 in 50: Lifetime risk of #melanoma at age 12: UV photography may help predict who #skincancer

citation.abstract: Ultraviolet (UV) photography has been used to motivate sun safety in behavioral interventions. The relationship between sun damage shown in UV photographs and melanoma risk has not been systematically investigated.
citation.journal: Journal of the American Academy of Dermatology
citation.title: Sun damage in ultraviolet photographs correlates with phenotypic melanoma risk factors in 12-year-old children

author.description: The Web's straight-from-the-source science news destination.

blogs.title: UV Photography Shows that Melanoma Risk Factors Correlate with Sun Damage
blogs.summary: There are a number of physical characteristics associated with increased risk of skin cancer, and more specifically, with melanoma, a particularly dangerous and aggressive form of skin cancer. These include blue eyes, red hair, freckles on the face, a sign

blogs.title: UV photographs of 12-year-olds show skin cancer risk
blogs.summary:
A UV photo shows sun damage hidden in traditional photography
THREE KEY POINTS:

UV photography shows spots of sun damage

The amount of sun damage seen in UV photography correlates with known melanoma risk factors — more sunspots equals higher risk

U

author.name: Colorado Cancer Blogs
author.description: News from the University of Colorado Cancer Center

reddit.title: Sun damage in ultraviolet photographs correlates with phenotypic melanoma risk factors in 12-year-old children

facebook.title: What you need to know about skin cancer
facebook.summary:
Specialized photography to show hidden UV damage is becoming more mainstream in sun safety counseling. Even kids can show damage early in life with these photos-See this free JAAD article: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3888435/
#Revealcamera
